–ò–≥—Ä–∞ –º–Ω–µ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ø–æ–Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–∞—Å—å. –ü—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–∂—É —Å –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–º —É–¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ–º. –ù–æ Sniper Ghost Warrior 3 —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç –∏–∑ Sniper Ghost Warrior 2 –∏ Far cry 4";"–†–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É—é
It had a lot of potential
column2: but most of it was not realized.
here are some of the main issues:

column1: The open world is as empty as most open world games these days.

column2: it has a pretty low rendering distance for enemies

column1: A bad AI that automatically detects your location even if they haven't spottet you yet.

column2: the voice acting gets pretty bad

column1: Various graphic and gameplay bugs to tarnish the overall fun.
So if you just want another universal open world shooter and don't mind most of your guns being sniper rifles then this game is for you. If you want something more
Now let's talk about the main point of sale: you are primarily a sniper.

column3: breath control and position along with a selection of weapons and bullets"" so let's break that claim down.
you have to press Q and E to change the height of the area whenever people are over 100m away
column6: will be most of the time.

column3: as the rendering distance for enemies is about 350-400 m.

column1: (except for some places where it seems 500m)

Wind speed and direction: the game shows you a little red bar on the top of the area to show you where the bullet will go. If you play on the easiest setup it even shows you through a small red dot where the bullet will land.
Breath control: just hold shift before taking a picture...
Position: doesn't matter with most rifles as the breath control does the job just fine.
Weapon selection: most weapons feel the same
column2: except perhaps for ammunition types. Oddly enough
column3: the last rifle you get seems to swing the most for some reason...

column1: Ammo picker: I played most of the game with regular bullets and only used special ones for achievements.
Marking a bullet is pretty useful
There are also bullets that will always fly straight

column2: in conclusion: take a rifle that doesn't have a bolt
column3: so you don't need to double-check after each shot.

column1: Always buy bipods when they are available because it stabilizes your rifle dramatically.
Use regular bullets for everything except maybe armor piercing when you want to be fancy.

column2: if you really don't like to take one shot
column3: then fight your assault rifle the rest of the time
column4: because every enemy in the Outpost now knows your exact location.

column2: this game has a system where you collect resources to create your own bullets.

column1: This system is completely outdated as you can just buy bullets and like any other open world shooter
column2: you get a lot more money than you need. I never ran out of money
column3: although I bought everything as soon as they became available.

column1: Climbing is probably the busiest part of the game
column2: making reaching ""death from below"" a real pain in the dick

column1: There is a macmillian sniper rifle which is obsolete after 3-4 missions...
There is a compound bow that can be found in the game...
Lydia's sabotage and escape is just a DLC story that should only be interesting to those who really invested in it... amazing story...

column3: is just skin for a jeep.

column1: And the rest of the multiplayer maps that don't have anyone interested because... who plays this multiplayer...
So Yes. A really good idea
column2: but the end result is mediocre in all aspects.

column4: will no longer be an open world. So I think it was just a failed CI Games experiment.

column1: I don't usually give ""out of ten"" points

column1: IGA-vania is back in style. Being a kickstarter project felt especially worrysome
column2: but Koji Igarashi took all the criticisms seriously and tackled them head on. The result of years of experience with the genre distilled into one game
column3: while also not limited with the previous console-based constrains
column4: is a wonder to behold. While it does invoke games such as Symphony of the Night
column5: Order of Ecclesia and Aria of Sorrow (in a tongue in cheek way)
column6: it still has enough of its own identity
column7: with many new monsters and bosses quickly becoming fan favorites. As a -vania fan though
column8: I have found it pretty easy to find my way to the true ending
column9: which seemed harder and more confusing to people unfamiliar with the conventions of the genre. But that is about the only negative part I could ever think of. At the moment of writing this review I have 100 % completion and I haven't even experimented with a lot of the abilities or tried an EX armor playthrough. Playable Zangetsu is still coming out
column10: so Ritual of the Night still has good things in store
column11: and hopefully will continue as a franchise.";"–†–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É—é

column4: L.A. Noire is a violent crime thriller that blends breathtaking action with true detective work to deliver an unprecedented interactive experience. Search for clues
column5: chase down suspects and interrogate witnesses as you struggle to find the truth in a city where everyone has something to hide.

column1: Amid the post-war boom of Hollywood's Golden Age
column2: Cole Phelps is an LAPD detective thrown headfirst into a city drowning in its own success. Corruption is rampant
column4: and murder rates are at an all-time high. In his fight to climb the ranks and do what's right
column5: Phelps must unravel the truth behind a string of arson attacks
column7: battling the L.A. underworld and even members of his own department to uncover a secret that could shake the city to its rotten core.
